The implementation and organisation of European and international mobility is carried out by the Erasmus+ Office, part of the Centre for International Relations.

	 The 33 Programme Countries are: the 28 EU Member States, and; Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, the Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia and Turkey.

	 Currently, the Centre implement two International Credit Mobility projects with partner institution from Australia, Bosnia-Herzegovina, China, Columbia, Montenegro, Russia, Serbia and Uzbekistan.
